translations.chinese: 諸父老皆曰：「平生所聞劉季奇怪，當貴，且卜筮之，莫如劉季最吉。」
translations.english: All the elders said: "In our lifetime we've heard that Liu Ji is extraordinary and should become noble. Moreover, when we consulted the divination, none was more auspicious than Liu Ji."

translations.chinese: 眾莫肯為，高祖乃立為沛公。
translations.english: No one else was willing to take it, so Emperor Gaozu was established as Lord of Pei.

translations.chinese: 祠黃帝，祭蚩尤於沛廷，而釁鼓旗。
translations.english: He sacrificed to the Yellow Emperor and made offerings to Chiyou in the Pei court, and smeared blood on the drums and flags.

translations.chinese: 幟皆赤，由所殺蛇白帝子，所殺者赤帝子故也。
translations.english: All the banners were red, because the snake he killed was the son of the White Emperor, and the one who killed it was the son of the Red Emperor.
